org.gearvrf

Class GVRDirectLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRJavaComponent
          • org.gearvrf.GVRLightBase
            • org.gearvrf.GVRDirectLight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener

    public class GVRDirectLight
extends GVRLightBase
    Illuminates object in the scene with a directional light source. The direction of the light is the forward orientation of the scene object the light is attached to. Light is emitted in that direction from infinitely far away. The intensity of the light remains constant and does not fall off with distance from the light.

    Dlrect light uniforms:

    derived from scene object orientation
    enabled1 = light is enabled, 0 = light is disabled/td>
    world_directiondirection of spot light in world coordinates
    ambient_intensityintensity of ambient light emitted
    diffuse_intensityintensity of diffuse light emitted
    specular_intensityintensity of specular light emitted
    sm0shadow matrix column 1
    sm1shadow matrix column 2
    sm2shadow matrix column 3
    sm3shadow matrix column 4
    Note: some mobile GPU drivers do not correctly pass a mat4 thru so we currently use 4 vec4's instead.
    See Also:
    GVRPointLight, GVRSpotLight, GVRLightBase

    • Method Detail

      • getAmbientIntensity

        public float[] getAmbientIntensity()
        Get the ambient light intensity. This designates the color of the ambient reflection. It is multiplied by the material ambient color to derive the hue of the ambient reflection for that material. The built-in phong shader GVRPhongShader uses a vec4 uniform named ambient_intensity to control the intensity of ambient light reflected.
        Returns:
        The current vec4 ambient_intensity as a four-element array

      • setAmbientIntensity

        public void setAmbientIntensity(float r,
                                float g,
                                float b,
                                float a)
        Set the ambient light intensity. This designates the color of the ambient reflection. It is multiplied by the material ambient color to derive the hue of the ambient reflection for that material. The built-in phong shader GVRPhongShader uses a vec4 uniform named ambient_intensity to control the intensity of ambient light reflected.
        Parameters:
        r - red component (0 to 1)
        g - green component (0 to 1)
        b - blue component (0 to 1)
        a - alpha component (0 to 1)

      • getDiffuseIntensity

        public float[] getDiffuseIntensity()

It is multiplied by the material diffuse color to derive the hue of the diffuse reflection for that material. The built-in phong shader GVRPhongShader uses a vec4 uniform named diffuse_intensity to control the intensity of diffuse light reflected.
        Returns:
        The current vec4 diffuse_intensity as a four-element array

      • getSpecularIntensity

        public float[] getSpecularIntensity()
        Get the specular intensity of the light. This designates the color of the specular reflection. It is multiplied by the material specular color to derive the hue of the specular reflection for that material. The built-in phong shader GVRPhongShader uses a vec4 uniform named specular_intensity to control the specular intensity.
        Returns:
        The current vec4 specular_intensity as a four-element array

      • setCastShadow

        public void setCastShadow(boolean enableFlag)
        Enables or disabled shadow casting for a direct light. Enabling shadows attaches a GVRShadowMap component to the GVRSceneObject which owns the light and provides the component with an orthographic camera for shadow casting.
        Overrides:
        setCastShadow in class GVRLightBase
        Parameters:
        enableFlag - true to enable shadow casting, false to disable

      • setShadowRange

        public void setShadowRange(float near,
                           float far)
        Sets the near and far range of the shadow map camera.

        This function enables shadow mapping and sets the shadow map camera near and far range, controlling which objects affect the shadow map. To modify other properties of the shadow map camera's projection, you can call GVRRenderTarget.getCamera() and update them.

        Overrides:
        setShadowRange in class GVRLightBase
        Parameters:
        near - near shadow camera clipping plane
        far - far shadow camera clipping plane
        See Also:
        GVRRenderTarget.getCamera()

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(float frameTime)
        Updates the position, direction and shadow matrix of this light from the transform of scene object that owns it. The shadow matrix is the model/view/projection matrix from the point of view of the light.
        Specified by:
        onDrawFrame in interface GVRDrawFrameListener
        Overrides:
        onDrawFrame in class GVRLightBase
        Parameters:
        frameTime - Seconds since the previous frame - see GVRContext.getFrameTime()
